featured.title: English Version of 'Code Geass: Lost Stories' Releases on September 13

news.title: 'Amagami-san Chi no Enmusubi' Reveals Main Staff, 2024 Premiere
news.text:
An official website opened for the television anime adaptation of Marcey Naitou's Amagami-san Chi no Enmusubi (Tying the Knot with an Amagami Sister) manga on Friday, revealing the main staff and a teaser visual (pictured). The anime is scheduled to air in 2024.

Staff
Director: Yuujirou Abe (Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!)
Assistant Director: Hiroshi Watanabe (Collar x Malice Movie: Deep Cover)
Series Composition: Yasuko Aoki (Kami Kuzu☆Idol)
Character Design: Haruko Iizuka (Horimiya)
Studio: Drive

The romantic comedy manga originally began as a one-shot by Naitou as part of Weekly Shounen Magazine's competition in December 2020. The one-shot received the most votes and began serializing on the same platform in April 2021. Kodansha shipped the 11th volume on July 14, while the 12th volume is set for an October 17 release. The manga has a cumulative 1 million copies of its volumes in circulation.

Kodansha USA licensed the manga for digital release in English in January 2022. The tenth volume went on sale on September 5.

Official site: https://amagami-anime.com/
Official X (Twitter): @amagami_anime

Source: animate Times

news.title: 'Metallic Rouge' Announces Main Cast Pair
news.text:
The official website of the Metallic Rouge television anime revealed the main cast pair and a character promo on Friday. The anime is scheduled to premiere in January 2024 on Fuji TV's +Ultra programming block.


Rouge Redstar: Yume Miyamoto (SSSS.Gridman)


Naomi Ortmann: Tomoyo Kurosawa (Cyberpunk: Edgerunners)


Motonobu Hori (Super Crooks) is directing the television anime at Bones. Yutaka Izubuchi (Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199) and Toshizou Nemoto (Steins;Gate) are in charge of the series composition and script, respectively. Toshihiro Kawamoto (Cowboy Bebop) is the character designer, and Taisei Iwasaki (Kekkai Sensen) is composing the music.

Metallic Rouge is an original action sci-fi TV anime commemorating the 25th anniversary of studio Bones.

Character PV


Source: Comic Natalie

Character PV


Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: 'Dekoboko Majo no Oyako Jijou' Unveils Supporting Cast, Third Promo
news.text:
The official website of the Dekoboko Majo no Oyako Jijou (The Family Circumstances of the Mismatched Witches) television anime revealed additional cast members and a third promotional video on Friday. The television anime is scheduled to premiere on October 1 at 10:00 p.m. on Tokyo MX, followed by BS Fuji and AT-X.

Cast
Pound: Katsuyuki Konishi (Helck)
Poisonous Koala: Ikue Ootani (Pokemon (2023))
Auri: Junichi Suwabe (Bleach)

Masahiro Takata (Tenkuu Shinpan) is directing the television anime at A-Real. Gyro Knuckle is handling the series composition, and Miwa Yoshida (Super Lovers animation director) is the character designer. myu (Kami Kuzu☆Idol) is composing the music.

The anime adapts Piroya's slice of life fantasy manga, which began serializing in July 2018 on Comic Meteor. Flex Comix published the fifth volume on April 12, and the sixth volume is scheduled for an October 12 release.

PV 3


Source: Comic Natalie

News submitted by Nioxys

news.title: 'Potion-danomi de Ikinobimasu!' Reveals Additional Staff, Third Promo
news.text:
The official website of the Potion-danomi de Ikinobimasu! (I Shall Survive Using Potions!) television anime revealed additional staff, the opening theme and third promo on Friday. The anime is set to air on October 8 at 2:00 a.m. on ABC TV and TV Asahi's 24 affiliated stations on the ANiMAZiNG!!! programming block, followed by BS Fuji and AT-X.

Staff
Sub-character Design: Hitomi Kaiho (Saikyou Onmyouji no Isekai Tenseiki Chief Animation Director)
Art Director: Minoru Ookouchi (Tantei wa Mou, Shindeiru.)
Color Design: Ryuusuke Araki (Hoshi no Samidare)
Director of Photography: Yasushi Hattori (Saikyou Onmyouji no Isekai Tenseiki)
Editing: Yuusuke Ueno (Otome Game Sekai wa Mob ni Kibishii Sekai desu)
Sound Director: Yayoi Tateishi (Tensei Oujo to Tensai Reijou no Mahou Kakumei)

Singer-songwriter katagiri is performing the opening theme "tailwind," which is previewed in the promotional video below.

Nobuaki Nakanishi (Hoshi no Samidare) directs television anime at Jumondo. Takayo Ikami (Isekai Cheat Magician) is in charge of the series composition, and Chisato Kikunaga (Kono Healer, Mendokusai) is designing the characters. Hiroaki Tsutsumi (Dr. Stone) is composing the music.

The anime adapts FUNA's fantasy light novel, which began on the Shousetsuka ni Narou website in November 2015. Kodansha acquired the novel and published the first volume in June 2017, featuring illustrations by Sukima. The ninth volume was released on March 2.

A manga adaptation by Hibiki Kokonoe began serializing in Suiyoubi no Sirius in June 2017. Kodansha published the ninth volume in December 2021.

J-Novel Club licensed both the light novel and manga in English in December 2018. The eighth novel volume went on sale on February 20, and the ninth manga volume was released in June 2022.

PV 3


Source: Comic Natalie

News submitted by Doshigatai

news.title: Manga 'Trillion Game' Gets TV Anime Adaptation
news.text:
Publishing company Kadokawa opened an official website for a television anime adaptation of Riichiro Inagaki and Ryouichi Ikegami's Trillion Game on Friday, scheduled to broadcast on TBS and other channels. Ikegami drew an illustration to commemorate the announcement (pictured).

Inagaki (Dr. Stone, Eyeshield 21) and Ikegami (Sanctuary, Crying Freeman) began serializing the seinen drama manga in Big Comic Superior in December 2020. Shogakukan published the seventh volume on July 12. Trillion Game has a cumulative 1.5 million copies of its volumes in circulation.

A television drama adaptation produced by TBS debuted on July 14, starring idol group Snow Man's Ren Meguro as Haru Tennouji and actor Hayato Sano as Manabu "Gaku" Taira. The drama series began developing original content episode eight onward, having adapted all available chapters.

Trillion Game placed among the top 20 titles in the Male Readers division in the Kono Manga ga Sugoi! 2022 rankings, and was nominated for the 15th Manga Taisho awards and 7th Tsugi ni Kuru Manga Taisho.

Synopsis
Meet Haru Tennouji, a charismatic communicator beloved by all, regardless of age or gender. He may come across as easygoing, but beneath that façade lies an unwavering ambition for success. When offered a prestigious position at the nation's largest IT company, "Dragon Bank," he does the unexpected—turning it down in favor of embarking on an entrepreneurial journey alongside his friend, Manabu Taira. Their audacious objective: to amass a staggering 1 trillion dollars.

Now, let's introduce Manabu, a brilliant engineer armed with remarkable IT acumen. Personality-wise, he's the antithesis of Haru—introverted, and a tad awkward in social interactions. Having faced rejection from "Dragon Bank" due to his communication challenges, he joins forces with Haru, sharing in the colossal ambition of earning that elusive 1 trillion dollars.

Announcement


Official site: https://trilliongame-anime.com/
Official X (Twitter): @trilliongame_pr

Source: Press Release

Trillion Game on MAL

news.title: 'BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!' TV Anime Gets Sequel
news.text:
The 13th and final episode of the BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!! television anime revealed on Thursday that a sequel, titled BanG Dream! Ave Mujica, is in production.

Produced by SANZIGEN, the television anime premiered on June 29. Crunchyroll simulcast the anime worldwide with English subtitles.

BanG Dream! Ave Mujica will focus on the story of the Ave Mujica band in the BanG Dream! franchise. The band released their first single "Kuro no Birthday" on April 11 and performed their first live concert on June 4 at Nakano Sunplaza.

The first television anime of the multimedia franchise, abbreviated as Bandori, was produced by Xebec and Issen in Winter 2017. A second season by SANZIGEN premiered in Winter 2019, followed by a third season in Winter 2020. The BanG Dream!: Poppin' Dream! movie, taking place after the third season, opened in Japan in January 2022.

The BanG Dream! Film Live and BanG Dream! Film Live 2nd Stage anime movies premiered in September 2019 and August 2021. The Episode of Roselia movies—Yakusoku and Song I Am., opened in theaters in April and June of 2021.

Announcement


Official site: https://anime.bang-dream.com/avemujica/
Official X (Twitter): @BDP_AveMujica
Ave Mujica on Bushiroad Music: https://bushiroad-music.com/artists/avemujica

Source: Oricon News

BanG Dream! Ave Mujica on MAL

news.title: Manga 'Dungeon Meshi' Ends
news.text:
Ryoko Kui's Dungeon Meshi (Delicious in Dungeon) manga ended with chapter 97 in Harta's 107th issue on Friday.

Kui began serializing the gourmet fantasy manga in the Harta magazine in February 2014. Kadokawa released the 12th volume on August 10, while the 13th and 14th volumes are scheduled to be released on December 15.

Yen Press licensed the manga in English in October 2016. The 12th volume went on sale on May 23.

A television anime adaptation by Trigger is scheduled to premiere in January 2024.

Dungeon Meshi ranked first and sixth in the 2016 and 2017's Kono Manga ga Sugoi! rankings for the Male Readers division. Dungeon Meshi also ranked four times in the Manga Taishou Awards in 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019.

Synopsis
After the Golden Kingdom is sunk underground by an insane magician, its king emerges, promising all of his treasure to any who defeat the magician, before crumbling to dust. Guilds are spurred on by this promise, traversing the labyrinthine dungeon in search of the magician. Laios, the leader of one such guild, encounters a dragon that wipes out his party and devours his sister Falin. Despite having lost the entirety of their supplies and belongings, Laios along with Marcille, an elven healer, and Chilchuck, a halfling thief, immediately reenter the dungeon, determined to save Falin.

Time being of the essence, Laios suggests the taboo of eating the monsters of the dungeon as a means of gathering supplies. Upon the preparation of their first meal in the dungeon, they are stopped by an onlooking dwarf named Senshi. An enthusiast of monster cooking, he helps them prepare their monster ingredients for safe consumption. After learning of Laios' circumstances, Senshi expresses his desire to cook a dragon and joins their guild, thus beginning their food-filled foray into the dungeon together. [Written by MAL Rewrite]

Source: Comic Natalie

News submitted by Nioxys

news.title: Manga 'Ao no Miburo' Receives TV Anime Adaptation
news.text:
A television anime adaptation of Tsuyoshi Yasuda's Ao no Miburo (The Blue Wolves of Mibu) manga was announced by publishing company Kodansha on Thursday. Yomiuri Telecasting simultaneously opened an official website, revealing the main staff, a visual for the protagonist Nio (pictured), and announcement promo.

Staff
Director: Kumiko Habara (100-man no Inochi no Ue ni Ore wa Tatteiru)
Series Composition: Kenta Ihara (Tsuki ga Michibiku Isekai Douchuu)
Character Design: Yuuko Ooba (Level 1 dakedo Unique Skill de Saikyou desu), Miyako Nishida (Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni.)
Sound Director: Toshiki Kameyama (Fantasy Bishoujo Juniku Ojisan to)
Music: Yuuki Hayashi (Boku no Hero Academia)
Studio: Maho Film

Yasuda began serializing the historical samurai manga in Weekly Shounen Magazine in October 2021, approximately eight months after ending his soccer manga Days in the same magazine. Kodansha published the tenth volume on Thursday, which also features the anime announcement on its wraparound band.

Kodansha USA licensed the manga in English in July and plans to release the first volume on February 27 next year.

Synopsis
It's 1863, the twilight of the shogunate, and Japan is on the cusp of monumental change. The streets of the nation's capital are soaked in blood as political upheaval and rising tensions between masterless, wandering ronin and government samurai set the stage for one of the most turbulent times in Japan's history. Young orphan Nio is no stranger to the harsh realities of the world, and yet he can't help but cling to his burning passion for justice and desire to change the world for the better.

One day, he crosses paths with two men who will become central figures of the coming revolution: Hijikata Toshizo and Okita Souji, two of the founding members of a group of hated ronin known as the Miburo—who would later become known as the Shinsengumi. Inspired by the efforts of the so-called "Blues Wolves of Mibu," Nio decides to join the ranks to help carve a path to the world he wishes to see. But with new betrayals and reversals every day, will Nio be able to stay true to his conscience? (Source: Kodansha USA, edited)

Announcement


Official site: https://miburoanime.com/
Official X (Twitter): @miburo_anime

Source: Comic Natalie

Ao no Miburo on MAL

news.title: 'Paradox Live the Animation' Announces Additional Staff, Theme Song Artists
news.text:
The official website of the Paradox Live television anime announced additional and theme song performers on Wednesday. The anime is scheduled to premiere on October 3 at 11:00 p.m on Tokyo MX, followed by BS Fuji and Animax. Abema, Anime Times, d Anime Store, and Lemino will also stream the anime.

An advance screening event for the anime titled Paradox Live The Animation Special Start Event will take place at Westa Kawagoe in Saitama on September 30. Animax will live broadcast the event.

Staff
Prop Design: Yuu Wazu (Hamatora The Animation character design)
Clothing Design: Miyuki Koga (Kageki Shoujo!!)
Concept Art: NAKAI
Art Director: Masatoshi Kai (Taisou Zamurai)
Color Design: Sayuri Yoshida (Shikioriori)
Editing: Gou Sadamatsu (Do It Yourself!!)
Director of Photography: Hisashi Matsumukou (Senjuushi)
Sound Director: Yukio Nagasaki (Love Live! Superstar!!)
Music: Taku Iwasaki (Bungou Stray Dogs)

The units BAE, The Cat's Whiskers, cozmez and Akanyatsura are performing the opening theme "RISE UP." The unit BURAIKAN will perform the ending theme "Every Day Every Night."

Naoya Andou (Aikatsu! episode director) is directing the anime at Pine Jam. Takayo Ikami (Mahou Shoujo Site) is handling the series composition and script. Kouji Haneda (Saihate no Paladin) is designing the characters.

Source: Comic Natalie

News submitted by Nioxys

news.title: Manga 'Hokuto no Ken' Gets New Anime Project
news.text:
Warner Bros. Japan announced a new anime project for Buronson and Tetsuo Hara's Hokuto no Ken (Fist of the North Star) manga on Wednesday, revealing a teaser visual (pictured). The new anime, titled Hokuto no Ken: Fist of the North Star, is celebrating the manga's 40th anniversary.

Buronson and Hara serialized the action drama in Weekly Shounen Jump from 1983 to 1988 and compiled into 27 volumes. Shueisha later reprinted the series in 15 collector's edition volumes in 1991–1992 and 15 bunkoban volumes in 1997–1998. Hokuto no Ken has sold a cumulative 100 million copies of its volumes worldwide.

Toei Animation produced a television anime adaptation, which aired in 109 episodes from October 1984 to March 1987. A second season aired from March 1987 to February 1988, followed by a three-episode original video anime from July 2003 to May 2004.

VIZ Media licensed the manga in English in October 2020 and shipped the ninth volume on June 27, with the tenth volume planned for a September 26 release.

Coamix published the first two volumes of an 18-volume new edition on Wednesday. The third and fourth volume will go on sale on September 20, and subsequent volumes will be released on the 20th of each month.

Synopsis
In 199x, the world was engulfed in the blaze of nuclear war.

With the Ocean drying up and Earth torn asunder, all life seems to be lost but humans survived stubbornly. However, what dominated the post-apocalyptic world was sheer violence. The remaining humanity was split into two groups: those who kill and take whatever they can and those who are exploited.

When all hope seems lost for the weak, a man in ragged cloth appears. He is Kenshiro, the rightful successor of the Hokuto Shinken martial arts with seven studs-like scars in the shape of the Big Dipper. His journey to becoming a legendary savior begins! (Source: Warner Bros. Japan, edited)

Official site: https://hokuto-no-ken.jp/40th/anime40fons
Official Twitter: @hokutonokeninfo

Source: Press Release

Hokuto no Ken: Fist of the North Star on MAL
news.textHTML:
Warner Bros. Japan announced a new anime project for Buronson and Tetsuo Hara's Hokuto no Ken (Fist of the North Star) manga on Wednesday, revealing a teaser visual (pictured). The new anime, titled Hokuto no Ken: Fist of the North Star, is celebrating the manga's 40th anniversary.

Buronson and Hara serialized the action drama in Weekly Shounen Jump from 1983 to 1988 and compiled into 27 volumes. Shueisha later reprinted the series in 15 collector's edition volumes in 1991–1992 and 15 bunkoban volumes in 1997–1998. Hokuto no Ken has sold a cumulative 100 million copies of its volumes worldwide.

Toei Animation produced a television anime adaptation, which aired in 109 episodes from October 1984 to March 1987. A second season aired from March 1987 to February 1988, followed by a three-episode original video anime from July 2003 to May 2004.

VIZ Media licensed the manga in English in October 2020 and shipped the ninth volume on June 27, with the tenth volume planned for a September 26 release.

Coamix published the first two volumes of an 18-volume new edition on Wednesday. The third and fourth volume will go on sale on September 20, and subsequent volumes will be released on the 20th of each month.

Synopsis
In 199x, the world was engulfed in the blaze of nuclear war.

With the Ocean drying up and Earth torn asunder, all life seems to be lost but humans survived stubbornly. However, what dominated the post-apocalyptic world was sheer violence. The remaining humanity was split into two groups: those who kill and take whatever they can and those who are exploited.

When all hope seems lost for the weak, a man in ragged cloth appears. He is Kenshiro, the rightful successor of the Hokuto Shinken martial arts with seven studs-like scars in the shape of the Big Dipper. His journey to becoming a legendary savior begins! (Source: Warner Bros. Japan, edited)

Official site: https://hokuto-no-ken.jp/40th/anime40fons
Official Twitter: @hokutonokeninfo

Source: Press Release

Hokuto no Ken: Fist of the North Star on MAL

news.title: 'Bokura no Ameiro Protocol' Announces Additional Cast
news.text:
The official website of the Bokura no Ameiro Protocol television anime revealed additional cast and a new key visual (pictured) on Tuesday. The anime is set to premiere on TV Asahi's 24 affiliated channels on the NUMAnimation programming block, followed by Miyazaki Broadcasting and BS Asahi in October 2023.

Cast
Ryuusei Nagamine: Tomozaki Sugita (Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu)
Mutsuki Naitou: Yoshitsugu Matsuoka (Sword Art Online)
Seshiru Satou: Kaede Honda (Majo no Tabitabi)
Emiko Takanashi: Azumi Waki (Blend S)

Daishi Katou (Warau Arsnotoria Sun! episode director) is directing the anime with chief director Yasutaka Yamamoto (Noblesse director ) at Quad. Katsuhiko Takayama and Yamamoto are handling the series composition. Kanna Hirayama ("Oshi no Ko") is designing the characters. Satoru Kousaki (Beastars) and MONACA (Summertime Render) are composing the music.

Source: Comic Natalie

News submitted by Nioxys

news.title: 'Cobra' Manga Author Buichi Terasawa Dies at 68
news.text:
Manga author Buichi Terasawa, best known for his manga Cobra (Space Adventure Cobra), died on September 8 due to a myocardial infarction. He was 68 years old.

The announcement was made Monday on Terasawa's work official Twitter by Manabu Furuse, representative of Terasawa Productions Inc. "Buichi Terasawa had survived three brain tumor surgeries with the same vitality as Cobra himself, but this time, he was caught off guard. It was a myocardial infarction," Furuse said. "We would like to express our deepest gratitude for your kindness during his life and respectfully inform you of his passing. The funeral will be held by family members only. Please pray for the repose of the soul of Buichi Terasawa."

Terasawa was born in Asahikawa City, Hokkaido Prefecture, in March 1955. He debuted in 1977 with the Cobra one-shot in the extra issue of Weekly Shounen Jump. The magazine began regular serialization of Cobra in 1978 where it ended in 1984.

In 1985, he began serializing Black Knight Bat in Weekly Shonen Jump. He founded Terasawa Productions In 1987 and became its president. In the same year, he serialized Midnight Eye Gokuu in Comic Burger magazine.

Terasawa announced on his official website in 2003 that a physical examination in 1998 revealed a malignant brain tumor for which he underwent surgery. Despite undergoing radiation and anticancer drug treatment, the tumor returned, and after the second surgery, he developed paralysis on the left side of his body. He used a wheelchair due to the side effects of the surgery. He began serializing a sequel to his original Cobra manga in November 2019 titled Cobra: Over the Rainbow.

VIZ Media licensed and published Cobra in English until the 12th issue. Creek ＆ River Co. licensed 15 volumes in digital format, including the original manga and various chapters from the sequel series.

The Space Adventure Cobra anime movie premiered in July 1982, which was followed by a television anime adaptation by Tokyo Movie Shinsha in Fall that year. The latest installment, Cobra The Animation, aired in Winter 2010.

Source: Livedoor News

News submitted by Doshigatai
news.textHTML:

Please pray for the repose of the soul of Buichi Terasawa."

news.title: 'Oomuro-ke' Announces Additional Cast
news.text:
The official website for the two anime movie adapting Namori's Oomuro-ke spin-off manga announced additional cast on Monday. The two anime movies, titled Oomuro-ke dear sisters and Oomuro-ke dear friends, are scheduled to premiere in 2024.

Cast
Kokoro Ogawa: Reo Kurachi (D4DJ First Mix)
Mirai Soma: Ayasa Itou (BanG Dream!)
MIsaki Takasaki: Aoi Koga (Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen)
Himawari Furutani: Suzuko Mimori (Yuru Yuri)

Naoyuki Tatsuwa (Nisekoi) helms the movies at Passione and Studio Lings. Masahiro Yokotani (Seishun Buta Yarou wa Bunny Girl Senpai no Yume wo Minai) is handling the series composition and penning the script. Kazuyuki Ueta (Kiniro Mosaic) is designing the characters and Yuusuke Shirato (Kunoichi Tsubaki no Mune no Uchi) is composing the music.

Namori began serializing the slice of life comedy manga on the Niconico Seiga website in July 2012 before moving to Ichijinsha's Niconico Yuri Hime magazine in February 2013. Following the suspension of Niconico Yuri Hime, the manga transferred to Yuri Hime@pixiv in August 2017 before switching to Comic Yuri Hime. Ichijinsha published the sixth volume in December 2022.

Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: 'Dead Mount Death Play Part 2' Reveals Main Staff, Teaser Promo, October 10 Premiere
news.text:
The official website of the Dead Mount Death Play television anime revealed staff changes, key visual (pictured), and a teaser promotional video for the second part on Monday. The second cour is scheduled to premiere on October 10 at 12:00 a.m. on Tokyo MX and BS11, followed by Sun TV, KBS Kyoto, AT-X, and Hokkaido TV.

Yoshihiro Satsuma is replacing Manabu Ono (Sword Art Online: Alicization) as the director of the second part at GEEK TOYS.

Ono is now credited as a supervisor but continues to handle the series composition and script with Yukie Sugawara (Overlord) and Yoriko Tomita (Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru). Other returning staff include character designer Hisashi Abe (Berserk) and music composer F.M.F..

Voice actress Inori Minase (Seishun Buta Yarou wa Bunny Girl Senpai no Yume wo Minai) is performing the opening theme "Scrap Art" and Yuuma Uchida (Kono Oto Tomare!) performing the ending theme "Hope."

The anime adapts Ryohgo Narita and Shinta Fujimoto's action fantasy manga, which began in Young Gangan in October 2017. Square Enix shipped the 11th volume on April 25.

Yen Press licensed the manga in English in October 2017. The ninth volume went on sale on July 18. The tenth volume is scheduled to be released on October 17.

Teaser PV


Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: PV Collection for Sep 4 - 10
news.text:
Here is a collection of promotional videos, television ads, teasers, and trailers that were released last week. This thread excludes videos that have already been featured in an article. Please check the News Board, under the Preview tag, for articles that feature a promotional video. Last week's PV thread can be found here.

Hibike! Euphonium 3 | TV | Teaser
The official website for the Hibike! Euphonium (Sound! Euphonium) franchise released a teaser video for its third season on Monday. The television anime produced by Kyoto Animation is scheduled to air in Spring 2024.




Kikansha no Mahou wa Tokubetsu desu | TV | PV
The official website of Kikansha no Mahou wa Tokubetsu desu (A Returner's Magic Should Be Special) released a key visual, promotional video and two character videos throughout the week. The promotional video previews the cast and opening theme song "GET BACK" by FLOW, while the character videos highlights Desir Arman and Romantica Eru, voiced by Takuma Terashima and Sayumi Suzushiro, respectively. Kikansha no Mahou wa Tokubetsu desu will be produced by Arvo Animation and premieres on October 8 at 12:00 a.m. via Tokyo MX, Gunma TV, Tochigi TV, and BS11.








Ooyukiumi no Kaina: Hoshi no Kenja | Movie | Trailer
The second trailer for Ooyukiumi no Kaina: Hoshi no Kenja (Kaina of the Great Snow Sea: Star Sage) previews the cast and features the film's main theme by Yorushika, titled "Gekkouyoku." The film produced by Polygon Pictures makes its theatrical debut in Japan on October 13.




Ragna Crimson | TV | PV
The fourth promotional video for SILVER LINK.'s anime adaptation of Ragna Crimson previews the cast alongside the series' ending theme song "Rinkaku" by Kobayashi Watashi. The television anime begins airing on October 1 at 1:00 a.m. via Tokyo MX and BS11, followed by MBS.




Toaru Ossan no VRMMO Katsudouki | TV | PV
The official website for Maho Film's anime adaptation of Toaru Ossan no VRMMO Katsudouki (A Certain Middle-Aged Man's VRMMO Activity Log) released the series' third promotional video on Tuesday. The video highlights the cast and previews the opening and ending theme songs. Toaru Ossan no VRMMO Katsudouki is scheduled to air on Tuesdays, starting on October 3 at 1:00 a.m. via BS11, followed by Tokyo MX.

news.title: 'Eiyuu Kyoushitsu' Unveils Additional Cast, Second Promo
news.text:
The official website of the Eiyuu Kyoushitsu (Class Room✿For Heroes) television anime revealed additional cast, new key visual (pictured), and a promotional video for the anime's climaxon Monday. The series premiered on July 9 at 11:00 p.m. on Tokyo MX, followed by Sun TV, KBS Kyoto, BS-NTV, and AT-X.

Cast
Une: Kanna Nakamura (Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru)
Deux: Natsumi Takamori (Another)
Trois: Yoshino Aoyama (Bocchi the Rock!)
Quatre: Saya Aizawa (Engage Kiss)
Cinque: Nene Hieda (Ganbare Douki-chan)

Keiichirou Kawaguchi (Higurashi no Naku Koro ni Gou) is directing the television anime at Actas. Naoki Hayashi (Citrus) is handling the series composition and script. Kousuke Kawamura (Island) is designing the characters and Koutarou Nakagawa (Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry) is composing the music.

The anime series adapts Shin Araki's school-themed action fantasy light novel, which launched under Shueisha's Dash X Bunko imprint in January 2015, featuring illustrations by Haruyuki Morisawa (Toaru Hikuushi e no Koiuta). The 14th volume was released on June 22.

Ultra Jump serialized a seven-chapter manga adaptation by Takashi Minakuchi from February to August 2015. Koara Kishida began a new manga adaptation in Monthly Shounen Gangan in September 2016. Square Enix published the 17th volume on July 12 and will release the volume 18th on September 12.

PV 2


Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: 'Azur Lane: Bisoku Zenshin!' Gets Second Season
news.text:
The Azur Lane 6th Anniversary Fes event announced a second season for the Azur Lane: Bisoku Zenshin! (Azur Lane: Slow Ahead!) television anime on Sunday. The event also revealed an announcement video.

Yostar Pictures and CANDY BOX produced the first season, which aired in Winter 2021. Crunchyroll streamed the anime with English subtitles.

The anime adapts Hori's slice of life spin-off manga which began on the Azur Lane's official Twitter. Serialization began in Comic Rex magazine in April 2018. Ichijinsha will ship the fourth volume on September 27.

The original Azur Lane smartphone game was developed in May 2017 by Shanghai Manjuu and Xiamen Yongshi and published by the streaming website Bilibili. The game was released in Japan in September 2017 by Yostar, with the official English localization released in May 2019. A comic anthology was released in January 2018, with a Playstation 3D game, Azur Lane Crosswave, released in August 2019 by Compile Hearts.

Synopsis
In a seemingly peaceful time without looming threats of Sirens or war, shipgirls from different nations live together in harmony. Some girls, such as the destroyers Ayanami, Javelin, Laffey, and Z23, attend school. Others immerse themselves into various other activities, including sports, foraging, training, going to formal parties, or even vying for the commander's attention! But one thing is for certain: the girls will continue to deepen their friendship in the pleasant port of Azur Lane! [Written by MAL Rewrite]

Announcement


Official site: https://azurlane-bisoku.jp/
Official Twitter: @azurlane_bisoku

Source: Game Biz

Azur Lane: Bisoku Zenshin! Season 2 on MAL

news.title: '16bit Sensation: Another Layer' Reveals Additional Cast, Staff, Main Promo
news.text:
The Aniplex Online Fest 2023 event revealed additional cast, staff, the main promo, and first key visual (pictured) for the 16bit Sensation: Another Layer anime series on Sunday.

The television anime adaptation of Tamiki Wakaki's workplace comedy web manga will begin airing on October 5 at 12:30 a.m. on Tokyo MX, Tochigi TV, Gunma TV, and BS11, followed by Chuukyou TV and ABC TV. The anime will also stream on d Anime Store on October 5 at 1:00 a.m. and other platforms beginning October 9 at 12:00 a.m.

Cast
Masaru Rokuta (Tenchou): Kentarou Itou (Golden Kamuy)
Kiyoshi Gomikawa (Kyonshii): Jun Fukushima (Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shoumei shitemita.)
Touya Yamada: Aya Yamane (Megami no Café Terrace)

Staff
Art Director: Hisae Arimoto (Hyakuren no Haou to Seiyaku no Valkyria art design)
Art Design: Hironori Yamamoto (Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai), Yumi Ishihara (Mononogatari)
Color Design: Haruko Nobori (Kakushigoto)
Director of Photography: Fumito Nanba (Spy Kyoushitsu)
Editing: Nobutaka Maki (Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Crystal)
Setting Research: RetroPC Foundation
Sound Effects: Yuuji Furuya (Gyakuten Sekai no Denchi Shoujo)
Recording Adjustment: Daiki Yamaki (Ore wo Suki nano wa Omae dake ka yo)

Takashi Sakuma (Sword Art Online: Alicization assistant director) is helming the anime at Silver. Tatsuya Takahashi (Saihate no Paladin series composition) and original creator Tamiki Wakaki (Kami nomi zo Shiru Sekai) are credited for the main story. Masakatsu Sasaki (Tonikaku Kawaii) is designing the characters and Yashikin (Ore ga Suki nano wa Imouto dakedo Imouto ja Nai) is composing the music.

Wakaki, Misato Mitsumi (To Heart 2), and AQUAPLUS' Tatsuki Amazuyu (Utawarerumono) originally began publishing the title as a doujinshi at Comiket 91 in 2016. The trio released seven volumes until Comiket 97 in 2019.

Kadokawa acquired the manga for commercial publication and shipped the first volume under its Kadokawa Shoten Tankobon label in September 2020. The second volume shipped in November 2021. Web manga platform ComicWalker also serializes the manga.

PV


Source: Press Release

Masakatsu Sasaki (Tonikaku Kawaii) is designing the characters and Yashikin (Ore ga Suki nano wa Imouto dakedo Imouto ja Nai) is composing the music.

Wakaki, Misato Mitsumi (To Heart 2), and AQUAPLUS' Tatsuki Amazuyu (Utawarerumono) originally began publishing the title as a doujinshi at Comiket 91 in 2016. The trio released seven volumes until Comiket 97 in 2019.

Kadokawa acquired the manga for commercial publication and shipped the first volume under its Kadokawa Shoten Tankobon label in September 2020. The second volume shipped in November 2021. Web manga platform ComicWalker also serializes the manga.

PV


Source: Press Release

news.title: 'ATRI: My Dear Moments' Announces Main Cast Members
news.text:
The Aniplex Online Fest 2023 event announced the main cast for the ATRI: My Dear Moments television anime on Sunday. The anime series adapting Aniplex.EXE's visual novel will broadcast in 2024. The main cast are reprising their roles from the visual novel.

Cast
Natsuki Ikaruga: Kensho Ono (Yuusha, Yamemasu)
Atri: Hikaru Akao (Assault Lily: Bouquet)
Minamo Kamishiro: Minami Takahashi (Arifureta Shokugyou de Sekai Saikyou)
Ryuuji Nojima: Yoshimasa Hosoya (Fuuto Tantei)
Ririka Nanami: Anzu Haruno (Kawaikereba Hentai demo Suki ni Natte Kuremasu ka?)

Makoto Katou (Yagate Kimi ni Naru) is directing the anime at TROYCA. Jukki Hanada (Sora yori mo Tooi Basho) is in charge of the series composition. Front Wing's Asuta Konno is credited as the original creator. Yusano and Motoyon drew the original character designs.

Developed by Frontwing and Makura, Aniplex.EXE published a demo version of the game in May 2020 before releasing the full version for Windows the following month in Japanese, English, simplified Chinese, and traditional Chinese simultaneously. iMel Inc. ported the game for smartphones and Nintendo Switch in December 2021.

CloverWorks produced a promotional video celebrating the game's full release in June 2020. Voice actress Hikaru Akao starred in the promo as Atri.

Source: Press Release

news.title: 'Ore dake Level Up na Ken' Reveals Additional Staff, Cast, First Promo
news.text:
The Aniplex Online Fest 2023 event unveiled additional staff, cast, the first promotional video, and second key visual (pictured above) for the Ore dake Level Up na Ken (Solo Leveling) anime series on Sunday. The television anime adaptation of Chugong and DUBU's action adventure manhwa will premiere in January 2024.

Voice actress Haruna Mikawa (Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru) is joining the cast as Aoi Mizushino (Jin-Ah Sung).

Staff
Sub-character Design: Chiaki Furuzumi (Engage Kiss)
Monster Design: Hirotaka Tokuda (Sword Art Online: Alicization sub-character design)
Prop Design: Soutarou Shiraishi (KanColle Movie key animation)
Art Director: Yasuhiro Okumura (Skate-Leading☆Stars)
Color Design: Naomi Nakano (Chainsaw Man)
Director of Photography: Daichi Iseki (No Guns Life)
CG Director: Toshitaka Morioka (Lycoris Recoil)
Motion Graphics: Hiromu Ooshiro (Production I.G) (Tengoku Daimakyou)
Editing: Yuuji Kondou (Fate/strange Fake: Whispers of Dawn)
Sound Director: Ryou Tanaka (Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life)

Shunsuke Nakashige (Megami-ryou no Ryoubo-kun.) is directing the anime at A-1 Pictures. Noboru Kimura (Kemono Jihen) is handling the series composition. Tomoko Sudou (Fragtime) is designing the characters and Hiroyuki Sawano (Shingeki no Kyojin) is composing the music.

Chugong originally launched Solo Leveling as a web novel on the Kakao website, which was published in 14 volumes by D&C Media from July 2016 to March 2018. The manhwa drawn by DUBE began in Kakao in March 2018 and ended on May 31.

PV 1


Source: Press Release
